en: I paid him five dollars.
I've tried reasoning with him but he just won't listen.
ko: 잘 설득해 보려고 했는데 도무지 말을 안 들어.

en: I have something that I want to say to him.
I admonished him against smoking for the sake of his health.
ko: 걔 건강 생각해서 담배 피우지 말라고 타이렀어.

en: I informed him of the result.
I liked him all the better for his faults.
I gave him a warning, to which he paid no attention.
ko: 걔한테 주의를 줬는데 들은 척도 안 하더라.

en: I gave him a warning, but he took no notice of it.
I warned him, but he ignored the warning.
I told him of our plans, but he seemed uninterested.
ko: 우리 계획을 말해줬는데 걔는 별로 관심 없는 것 같더라.

en: I made him change his plan.
I got him to polish my shoes.
I asked him to mend my shoes.
ko: 걔한테 내 구두 좀 고쳐달라고 부탁했어.

en: I met him by chance.
I gave him a gold watch.
I trusted him with the money.
I presented him with a gold watch.
I told him what to see in Kyoto.
ko: 교토에서 가볼 만한 곳들 걔한테 알려줬어.

en: I have not seen him for a long time.
I got him to stop smoking.
I advised him to give up smoking, but he would not listen to me.
ko: 담배 끊으라고 충고했는데 내 말을 안 듣더라고.

en: I have to do right by him.
I was ashamed of showing my face to him.
I got him to paint the fence.
I have tried to discourage him from going abroad.
I hid myself so that I might not meet him.
It was only when I met him that I realized his true intention.
ko: 걔를 직접 만나고 나서야 본심을 알게 됐어.

en: I can't forget the day when I met him.
ko: 걔를 만난 날을 잊을 수가 없어.

en: I can't forget the day I met him.
I have met him before.
I saw him.
I met him.
I went there to meet him.
I went there for the purpose of meeting him.
I must go and see him.
I advised him not to grieve over the past.
ko: 지난 일로 슬퍼하지 말라고 걔한테 말해줬어.

en: I made him paint the house.
I had him carry my luggage to the platform.
ko: 걔한테 승강장까지 짐 좀 들어달라고 했어.

en: I am indebted to him.
I didn't know what to say to him.
ko: 걔한테 무슨 말을 해야 할지 몰랐어.

en: I told him what to do.
I answered his blows with several of my own.
ko: 걔가 때리길래 나도 몇 대 때려줬어.

en: I advised him against smoking.
I warned him not to smoke.
I instructed him in English.
I tried to get him to learn to drive.
I advised him not to drive.
I'm attracted to him.
I remember seeing him once.
ko: 그 사람 한 번 본 기억이 나.

en: I regret that I have never been kind to him.
ko: 그 사람한테 좀 더 잘해주지 못한 게 후회돼.

en: I told him not to go to the place alone.
ko: 거기 혼자 가지 말라고 그 사람한테 말했어.

en: I remember seeing him somewhere before.
ko: 전에 어디선가 그 사람 본 적 있는 것 같아.

en: I persuaded him that he should try again.
ko: 다시 한번 해보라고 그 사람을 설득했어.

en: I met him by pure chance.
I handed the mike to him.
I'll buy a pen for him.
ko: 그 사람한테 펜 하나 사줄 거야.

en: I plan to buy him a pen.
ko: 그 사람한테 펜 하나 사줄 계획이야.

en: I'll give him a pen.
ko: 그 사람한테 펜 하나 줄 거야.

en: I couldn't put up with him.
I am no match for him.
ko: 난 그 사람 상대가 안 돼.

en: I bought him a tie.
I bear him no malice.
I wrote him to ask why.
ko: 왜 그랬는지 물어보려고 그 사람한테 편지 썼어.

en: I remember that I met him somewhere.
ko: 어디서 그 사람 만났던 게 기억나.

en: I asked him where I should park my car.
ko: 차 어디에 세워야 하는지 그 사람한테 물어봤어.

en: I asked him where he was going.
I remember seeing him somewhere.
ko: 어디서 그 사람 본 기억이 나.

en: I asked him to open the door, but he would not do so.
ko: 문 좀 열어달라고 했는데 그 사람이 안 열어주더라고.

en: He opened the door, though I told him not to.
ko: 하지 말라고 했는데도 그 사람이 문을 열었어.

en: I asked him to come with me and he agreed.
ko: 같이 가자고 했더니 그 사람이 그러겠대.

en: I advised him to give up smoking.
I asked him not to drive so fast.
ko: 너무 빨리 달리지 말라고 그 사람한테 말했어.

en: I couldn't make him understand it.
I promised him to keep it secret.
I had him write it.
I advised him to keep that promise.
ko: 그 약속 지키라고 그 사람한테 충고했어.

en: I want him to solve the problem.
I thanked him for the nice present.
ko: 멋진 선물 고맙다고 그 사람한테 인사했어.

en: I paid him on the spot for his work.
ko: 일한 거 그 자리에서 바로 돈 줬어.

en: I regret having said that to him.
ko: 그 사람한테 그 말 한 게 후회돼.

en: I paid him the money.
I explained the rule to him.
I admonished him of the danger.
I warned him about the danger.
I warned him of the danger.
ko: 위험할 수 있다고 그 사람한테 경고했어.

en: I told him the big news.
I want him to go there.
I wanted him to go there.
I made him do so.
I found him a nice apartment.
ko: 그 사람한테 괜찮은 아파트 하나 찾아줬어.

en: I reminded him to write to his mother soon.
ko: 어머니한테 곧 편지 쓰라고 그 사람한테 말해줬어.

en: I advised him to come back at once.
I caught up with him soon.
I asked him to start at once.
I asked him to begin his trip at once.
ko: 당장 여행 떠나라고 그 사람한테 말했어.

en: I asked him to leave at once.
I asked him if he would return soon.
ko: 곧 돌아올 건지 그 사람한테 물어봤어.

en: I will make him do it at once.
ko: 그 사람한테 그거 당장 하게 할 거야.

en: I'll get him to carry my suitcase upstairs.
ko: 걔한테 내 캐리어 위층으로 좀 옮겨달라고 하려고.

en: I made him carry the suitcase.
I had him take my suitcase to the room.
ko: 걔한테 내 캐리어 방으로 가져다 달라고 했어.

en: I don't want him to touch me.
I borrowed this book from him.
I slipped the letter to him.
I asked him to be here by six.
I asked him to wait here.
I want him to play the guitar.
I asked him to make tea.
I am not so foolish as to lend him money.
ko: 걔한테 돈 빌려줄 만큼 바보는 아니야.

en: I'm not stupid enough to lend him money.
ko: 걔한테 돈 빌려줄 정도로 멍청하지 않아.

en: I asked him to lend me some money.
I left the money with him.
I had to lend to him money.
I offered him some money, but he would not take it.
ko: 걔한테 돈 좀 주려고 했는데 안 받더라고.

en: I know that I should not tell him a lie.
ko: 걔한테 거짓말하면 안 된다는 거 알아.

en: I suggested that he try to go to America.
Every time I meet him, I think of my father.
ko: 걔 만날 때마다 우리 아빠 생각나.

en: I lent him a CD.
I asked him to come at eight, but he turned up at nine.
I owe him no less than 50,000 yen.
I paid five dollars to him.
I offered him odds of 3 to 1.
I have written to him once a month for almost twenty years.
ko: 거의 20년 동안 걔한테 한 달에 한 번씩 편지 썼어.

en: I took him a cup of coffee.
I got him to wash my car for a hundred dollars.
I persuaded him that he was wrong.
I congratulated him on the birth of his son.
ko: 걔 아들 태어난 거 축하해 줬어.

en: I told him not to throw stones.
I advised him to be independent of his parents.
I tried to explain to him that we were not responsible for his mistake, but he refused to listen.
ko: 걔 실수가 우리 책임 아니라고 설명하려고 했는데, 안 듣더라고.

en: I asked him to come with me, for I was a stranger in that part of the city.
ko: 그쪽 지리를 잘 몰라서 걔한테 같이 가달라고 했어.

en: I told him to work hard and he would succeed.
ko: 열심히 하면 성공할 거라고 걔한테 말해줬어.

en: I told him to work hard or he would fail.
ko: 열심히 안 하면 실패할 거라고 걔한테 말해줬어.

en: I can't get by without him.
I can't relax when I'm talking with him.
ko: 걔랑 얘기할 땐 긴장이 안 풀려.

en: On having a talk with him, I found him troubled but friendly.
ko: 걔랑 얘기해 보니까 고민은 있어 보이는데 친절하더라.

en: I enjoyed talking with him.
I cannot get in touch with him.
I want to get in touch with him.
I got in touch with him.
I have an appointment to dine with him.
I made friends with him.
I competed with him for the championship.
I talked with him far into the night.
I would like to talk to him face to face.
ko: 걔랑 직접 얼굴 보고 얘기하고 싶어.

en: I am on visiting terms with him.
ko: 걔랑은 서로 집에도 놀러 가는 사이야.

en: I don't enjoy his society.
ko: 걔랑 같이 있는 거 별로 안 좋아해.

en: I don't enjoy hanging out with him.
Hanging out with him isn't interesting.
I would rather remain single than live an unhappy life with him.
ko: 걔랑 불행하게 살 바엔 그냥 혼자 살래.

en: I have as many books as he.
I have as many books as he does.
I have the same number of books as he has.
I am as tall as he.
I'm as tall as he is.
I'm the same height as he is.
I love you as much as him.
I am as old as he.
I'm as old as he is.
I've got as much money as he has.
I parted from him on the street.
I am to have lunch with him.
I'm scheduled to have lunch with him.
I plan to have lunch with him.
I am on good terms with him. He always keeps his promises and is relied upon by everybody.
ko: 나 걔랑 잘 지내. 걔는 항상 약속도 잘 지키고 모두가 신뢰하는 애야.

en: I struck up an acquaintance with him.
I have known him a long time.
I am acquainted with him.
I negotiated the price with him.
I don't mind sharing the room with him.
I have been honest with him.
I cooperated with him in the task.
ko: 그 일 걔랑 같이 협력해서 했어.

en: I will never forget the day when I first met him.
ko: 걔 처음 만난 날 절대 못 잊을 거야.

en: I work with him.
I intended to go with him.
I agree to go with him.
I never exchanged a word with him.
I went to church with him.
I worked hand in hand with him.
I went into partnership with him.
I associate with him in business.
I will associate with him in business.
I ran a race with him.
I had a race with him.
I had a chance to see him.
I play with him.
I go to school with him.
I would rather stay home than go out with him.
I never feel at home in his company.
I raced him a mile.
I would often play tennis with him.
I share with him in the enterprise.
ko: 그 사업 걔랑 같이 하고 있어.

en: I got acquainted with him in France.
Seldom do I see him.
I seldom see him.
I hardly ever run into him.
I have done with him.
I enjoyed talking with him at the party.
I had a tennis match with him.
I could not bring myself to dance with him.
ko: 걔랑은 도저히 춤출 마음이 안 생기더라고.

en: I can't do with him and his insolent ways.
ko: 걔의 무례한 태도는 정말 못 봐주겠어.

en: I have to talk with him about the new plan.
ko: 걔랑 새 계획에 대해 얘기 좀 해야 돼.

en: I must discuss that new plan with him.
ko: 그 새 계획에 대해 걔랑 상의해야 해.

en: I discussed the matter with him.
I argued with him about it.
ko: 그것 때문에 걔랑 말다툼 좀 했어.

en: I accompanied him on the trip.
I didn't want to work with him, but I made the best of it.
ko: 걔랑 일하기 싫었지만 그래도 최대한 잘해보려고 했어.

en: I found a good friend in him.
ko: 걔한테서 참 좋은 친구의 모습을 발견했어.

en: I made an appointment to see him at seven o'clock.
I am to meet him at six.
I was meeting him at the station at six.
I have been associated with him for ten years.
I don't know whether he'll come by train or by car.
ko: 걔가 기차로 올지 차로 올지 모르겠어.

en: I found him a bright boy.
I expect him to come every moment.
I expect him to come at any moment.
I'm sure he will come.
I thought he would come.
I am certain of his coming.
I'm certain that he'll come.
I thought he might come.
I expected him to come.
I am sure of his passing the coming entrance examination.
ko: 걔가 이번 입시에서 꼭 합격할 거라고 확신해.

en: I could not help laughing to see him dancing.
ko: 걔가 춤추는 거 보고 웃지 않을 수가 없었어.

en: I didn't like him much; in fact I hated him.
ko: 걔 별로 안 좋아했어. 사실은 싫어했지.

en: I know that he is a famous musician.
ko: 걔가 유명한 음악가라는 건 알고 있어.

en: I was convinced that he was guilty.
I know that he keeps his promise.
ko: 걔가 약속은 꼭 지킨다는 걸 알아.

en: I am confident he will keep his promise.
I think it doubtful whether he will keep his word.
I believed that he would keep his promise.
I'm sure he'll be as good as his word.
ko: 걔는 말한 대로 꼭 할 거야.

en: I saw him playing baseball.
ko: 걔가 야구 하고 있는 거 봤어.

en: I saw him play baseball.
I had just written the letter when he came back.
ko: 막 편지를 다 썼는데 걔가 돌아왔어.

en: I thought that he was innocent.
I saw him walking with a book under his arm.
ko: 걔가 겨드랑이에 책 끼고 걷는 거 봤어.

en: I am sure of his winning the speech contest.
ko: 걔가 스피치 대회에서 우승할 거라고 확신해.

en: I was very surprised to find him in disguise.
ko: 걔가 변장한 거 보고 진짜 놀랐어.

en: I noticed him sitting with his back against the wall.
ko: 걔가 벽에 등을 기대고 앉아 있는 걸 봤어.

en: We caught him trying to go out of his room.
ko: 우리 걔가 방에서 나가려는 거 붙잡았어.

en: I caught him trying to go out of the room.
ko: 난 걔가 방에서 나가려는 거 붙잡았어.

en: I thought he was sick.
I am sure of his coming to the party.
ko: 걔가 파티에 꼭 올 거라고 확신해.

en: I'm sure that he'll come to the party.
I saw him pat her on the shoulder.
ko: 걔가 그 여자 어깨를 다독이는 거 봤어.

en: I saw him scolded by his mother.
I saw him being scolded by his mother.
ko: 걔가 엄마한테 혼나고 있는 거 봤어.

en: I heard of his involvement in crime.
I caught him trying to sneak out.
ko: 걔 몰래 나가려던 거 딱 걸렸어.

en: I didn't know that he was Japanese.
I helped him to carry his baggage upstairs.
ko: 걔 짐 위층으로 옮기는 거 도와줬어.

en: I helped him carry his luggage upstairs.
ko: 걔 짐 위층으로 옮기는 거 도와줬어.

en: I saw him cross the road.
I saw him crossing the road.
ko: 걔 길 건너고 있는 거 봤어.

en: I saw him running away.
I take it for granted that he would come.
I saw him crossing the street.
I helped him walk across the street.
I helped him cross the street.
I watched him cross the street.
I don't know why he was late.
I was angry because he was late.
I asked who he was.
I know who he is.
I have known him since he was a baby.
I do not doubt that he is sincere.
ko: 걔가 진심이라는 거 의심 안 해.

en: I visited the village where he was born.
I know the house where he was born.
I like him in that he is honest and candid.
I believe that he is honest.
I don't consider him honest.
I like him because he is honest.
I don't think that he's right.
I saw that he was right.
I think he will succeed.
I am sure that he will succeed.
I'll hire whoever he recommends.
ko: 걔가 추천하는 사람은 누구든 뽑을 거야.

en: I have never heard him speak ill of others.
ko: 걔가 남 험담하는 거 한 번도 못 들었어.

en: I'm thinking he was a kind man.
I found him kind.
I've never seen him really get down to work.
ko: 걔가 본격적으로 일하는 걸 본 적이 없어.

en: I listened to him explain a new product.
It was not until I saw him laughing that I realized what a fool I had been.
ko: 걔가 웃는 걸 보고서야 내가 얼마나 바보 같았는지 깨달았어.

en: I found that he was gazing at me at a distance.
ko: 걔가 멀리서 나를 빤히 쳐다보고 있는 걸 발견했어.

en: I expect him to help me.
I have a letter written by him.
I arrived on the night he left.
I didn't notice him go out.
I saw him go out.
I caught him stealing the camera.
ko: 걔가 카메라 훔치는 거 딱 걸렸어.

en: I thought he was going to fail the exam, but he passed after all.
ko: 걔 시험 떨어질 줄 알았는데 결국 붙었더라.

en: I expect he'll pass the examination.
I am sure of his passing the exam.
I was banking on him to help me.
ko: 걔가 도와줄 거라고 굳게 믿고 있었어.

en: I looked to see if he was teasing me.
ko: 걔가 나 놀리는 건가 싶어서 살펴봤어.

en: I expect him to take care of my younger brother.
ko: 걔가 내 동생 잘 돌봐줄 거라고 믿어.

en: I am convinced of the truth that he was in love with my sister.
ko: 걔가 내 여동생을 좋아했다는 건 확실해.

en: I don't like him coming to my house so often.
ko: 걔가 우리 집에 너무 자주 오는 거 싫어.

en: I caught him speaking ill of me.
ko: 걔가 내 욕하는 거 딱 걸렸어.

en: I noticed he was wearing my slippers.
ko: 걔가 내 슬리퍼 신고 있는 거 봤어.

en: I suggested that he follow my advice.
I can't understand what he wants me to do.
ko: 걔가 나보고 뭘 어쩌라는 건지 모르겠어.

en: I was afraid he might die.
I observed him stop.
I noticed that he had stopped.
I remember the year when he got a job.
I will stop him from going.
I wish to spare him the trouble of going there.
ko: 걔가 거기까지 가는 수고를 덜어주고 싶어.

en: I can't understand what he is thinking about.
I came to like him.
I found him riding a bicycle in the park.
ko: 공원에서 걔가 자전거 타고 있는 걸 봤어.

en: I can't make out what he was saying.
I believed every word he said.
ko: 걔가 하는 말을 곧이곧대로 다 믿었어.

en: I can figure out what he is trying to say.
ko: 걔가 무슨 말을 하려는 건지 알 것 같아.

en: I understand what he's trying to say.
I think he is the greatest artist of the time.
ko: 걔가 이 시대 최고의 예술가라고 생각해.

en: I do not care for him.
I think him in good health.
I affirmed that he was innocent.
I soon noticed his absence.
I know the real reason for his absence.
ko: 걔가 안 온 진짜 이유를 알아.

en: I saw him caught by the police.
I found that he was turned over to the police.
ko: 걔가 경찰에 넘겨졌다는 걸 알게 됐어.

en: I'm surprised to hear that he is in prison.
ko: 걔가 감옥에 있다는 소릴 듣고 놀랐어.

en: I think it strange that he didn't speak to you.
ko: 걔가 너한테 말을 안 걸었다는 게 좀 이상해.

en: I think it's strange that he didn't speak to you.
ko: 걔가 너한테 말을 안 했다는 게 이상하다고 생각해.

en: I had a fancy that I could see him approaching.
ko: 걔가 다가오는 것 같은 기분이 들었어.

en: I took it for granted that he would win the race.
I was not conscious of his presence.
I had a suspicion that he would leave me.
ko: 걔가 날 떠날 것 같다는 의심이 들었어.

en: I don't know the reason why he was absent.
ko: 걔가 왜 안 왔는지 이유를 몰라.

en: I worry about him.
I helped him carry his desk.
I convinced him that he was wrong.
I don't know why he quit the company.
I was not aware of his absence from the meeting.
I caught him stealing pears in the orchard.
ko: 과수원에서 걔가 배 훔치는 걸 잡았어.

en: I saw him enter the house.
I don't know for certain who he is.

ko: 걔가 무슨 뜻으로 말한 건지 이해가 안 갔어.

en: I couldn't make out what he wanted to say.
ko: 걔가 무슨 말을 하고 싶은 건지 알 수가 없었어.

en: I am convinced that he did nothing wrong.

en: I didn't know that he could speak English.
ko: 걔가 영어 할 줄 아는지 몰랐어.

en: I have never heard him speak English.

en: I saw him swim across the river.
ko: 걔가 강을 헤엄쳐서 건너는 걸 봤어.

en: I suspected he was a liar.

ko: 걔 공원에서 혼자 걷고 있는 거 봤어.

en: I don't know if he is a doctor.
I don't know if he's a doctor.

I learned much about astronomy from him.
I got the information from him directly.
I was laughed at by him.
I don't have contact recently from him.
I hear from him once a month.

en: I learned a lot from him.

I thought he would come soon.
I ascertained that he was still alive.
I checked to make sure that he was still alive.

ko: 걔가 실수한 거니까 화 안 났어.

en: I heard him mumble to himself.

ko: 걔 피아노 치는 거 한 번 들어봤어.

en: I don't care what he says.

I know where he lives.

en: I am sure of his winning the tennis match.

en: I was glad to see that he finally came to his senses.

en: I thought him a poor dancer.
ko: 걔 춤 진짜 못 춘다고 생각했어.

en: I don't know if he knows it.
I think he has done it.
I know that it was done by him.
I think he did it.

ko: 걔가 그 문제 푸는 건 불가능할 것 같아.

en: I'm surprised that he accepted the offer.

en: I saw him tear up the letter.

en: I don't know the reason why he went there.

en: I heard him sing at the concert.

en: I will ask him where he went last Sunday.

en: I know that he will be introduced to a lady by his uncle today.

en: I came into a huge fortune.

en: I like red wine better than white wine.
ko: 전 화이트 와인보다 레드 와인을 더 좋아해요.

en: I applied to be an attendant at the exposition.
